data.title: Real Madrid wonderkid Martin Odegaard shows off gorgeous skills in youth game for Castilla
data.meta_description: Watch the young Norwegian produce backheels, perfect passes and sublime nutmegs - he's got bags of talent, that's for sure
data.text:
While Real Madrid are yet to suffer a defeat in La Liga this season, youth side Castilla lost their first game of the season this weekend - a frustrating result for lads aspiring to be the Bernabeu's next big stars.

You might think that it'd be hard to find too many positives in a 2-0 away loss to Getafe's reserves. However, there was one shining light in the dark, dark depths of defeat.

That shining light was none other than Martin Odegaard .

Odegaard is surely one of the most talked about young prospects in world football at the moment. The 16-year-old Norwegian has already made his senior debut for Los Blancos, while his efforts on the international scene have been widely praised. Watch this footage and you'll see why he's so highly regarded - the skills he shows off here are nothing short of sublime.

It becomes apparent very early on in the match that Odegaard is a huge fan of the backheel pass - his reverse flick is the stuff dreams are made of. Likewise, we have to praise his penchant for an audacious nutmeg. He absolutely schools at least one opponent here. We certainly wouldn't want to play against him.

He'll want to help his side improve results, of course. Still, as individual showings go, this was a pretty sweet performance.
